wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup 8/7/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

The Secret To Engaged Employees, Especially Women And Millennials

An increasingly younger and more diverse workforce is forcing organizations to think beyond pool tables and other fun perks to actually satisfy their workforce and drive employee engagement. So what do companies need to do? Three key things: [1] focus on helping employees realize personal growth, [2] build meaningful relationships, and [3] instill the knowledge and organizational transparency so that employees know they are making a difference. While this is not an easy task, organizations should focus on five key strategies to crack the code on employee engagement and build an organization based on purposeful work.

Brands should focus on a higher purpose, not just profits

87% of respondents around the world in the recent Edelman’s Brandshare report said they want a meaningful relationship with brands, yet the Harvard Business Review found only 23% of consumers feel they have one. So how do organizations bridge this gap and make their brand significant? Salesforce’s Jeremy Waite defines these [brands] as ones that are conscious of their impact and run by people with belief in a greater purpose ‘ be it social or ecological. These are brands that want to generate ‘loyalty beyond reason’ and ultimately, beyond profits.

Taking a Stance on Sustainability: Start Internally

As COP21 approaches, there is a renewed energy around the impact organizations can make on international goals. Global organizations that embed sustainability into their corporate culture and inspire all stakeholders to act will have the opportunity to make substantial change. To do this, companies must look internally to align and empower employees. First, benchmark your organization across peers and industry to establish areas to improve. Once your organization knows where the gaps are, inspire your employees to help achieve these goals.

Culture, Brand, Engagement: How Benefits Support HR’s Three-Legged Stool

Culture, brand and engagement support HR’s three-legged stool, and the recent Deloitte University Press Global Human Capital Trends 2015 report finds weaknesses in each of these key pillars. Notably, 87% of organizations cite workforce culture and engagement as top challenges, and 71% of respondents stressed the importance of reinventing their HR, but only 42% said they felt actually prepared and ready to do it. One key factor that influences all three pillars is corporate benefits, which can serve as a powerful connector between an employer brand, the HR department and employees.

Catalyzing the Purpose-Driven Employee

With today’s new workforce, organizations are now filled with purpose-driven employees ‘ those that are motivated and engaged by meaningful work. As a business, how do you empower these employees to become a purpose-driven organization? This article provides three essential strategies for businesses to activate their workforce and participate in the purpose-led movement.
